title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [28 march 1870]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [28 March 1870]
text: 28 March 1870mondayMondayMy dear waltWalti received your letter and paper with Jesse death in it poor soul i hope heshe's better off but it makes me feel very sad didentdidn't the doctor say any thing about how long he was sick before he died walterWalter has doctor chappinChapin left the institution i see it wasentwasn't his name that sent you the letter i didentdidn't write to George as he will be home fridayFriday or saturdaySaturday he aintain't very busy now i am sorry waltWalt you have a cold doodo you have them dissydizzy spells you had home i shall be glad when it comes time for you to come home i have had a letter from mattyMatty she is quite smart says the children is making reckoning of your coming out therewalter i did want the envelopes with your name on i haventhaven't one marthaMartha used them to write to you when she was here or i shouldentshouldn't be out) walterWalter dear you needentneedn't send the order this week next week will doo) you may send the papers this week if conveinentconvenientwe have had great havoc here in brooklynBrooklyn with the storm we didendidn't feel much the effects only the smoke came down the chimney bad by spells it was a dreary day your mother Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [28 March 1870]
